name: LANDBAY
description:
LANDBAY - The full-stack mortgage lender

Landbay facilitates retail, institutional and local government investment into UK residential mortgages. We direct-match funding to diversified portfolios via our platform, supporting the growth of quality private rental accommodation throughout England and Wales. 

Landbay mortgages are originated through a network of accredited intermediaries and via strategic partnerships, including Zoopla Property Group.

Fully authorised and regulated by the FCA. No FSCS. Capital at risk.

team.title: Co-founder / Non-Exec
team.name: Gray Stern
team.bioHtml:
Founder & CEO, Dot Residential. 
Co-Founder & Non-Exec, Landbay.

team.title: Backend Engineer
team.name: Heather Whyte
team.bioHtml: Backend Engineer @LANDBAY (We're hiring!) Fintech, Java, microservices, devOps, and all that other fun stuff.

jobs.title: Graduate Java Engineer
jobs.description:
Your Skills
------------------------------ 
•	You can code in some language (preferably Java, or another OOP language)
•	You have solved complex problems in your course (e.g. your final year project is one you're proud of)
•	Good understanding of algorithms and data structures
•	You understand and have worked with RESTful APIs
•	You're a fast learner and self-starter
•	You've got some understanding of relational databases such as MySQL or Oracle
•	You'll come to the interview prepared and knowing roughly what the following mean: Agile, micro-services, Cloud technologies, AWS, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployments, Docker containers, Synchronous vs Asynchronous.
•	Extra bonus points if you've had an internship applying some of your tech skills or knowledge


Education  (preferred)
------------------------------ 
•	Degree in Computer Science or training in an accredited programme (Expected 1st or 2.1)

How We Work
------------------------------ 
•	Start from a user story and design a solution spanning micro-services
•	Develop, test, and deploy software and ensure high code quality at every step
•	Collaborate with the team to continuously improve the architecture
•	Contribute to continuous improvement within the scrum team
•	Participate in the "automate everything" mentality (e.g. Continuous Deployment pipelines, Jenkins, etc.)
•	Prototype and spike new concepts, features, and use of technology


Candidate Profile
------------------------------ 
•	Want to be part of the company, not just crunching code all the time - and you know why that makes you a better software engineer
•	Not afraid to try things or to fail
•	Love white-boarding problems and solutions
•	Excited to work in an agile environment with lean processes and as-needed prototyping
•	Confident in your convictions but you recognise the value in diverse opinions in the creative process
•	Want to do things the right way but accept that sometimes the wrong way is better
•	Good sense of humour
•	Understand that good interpersonal skills are often more important to developing good software than the tin it sits on.


Benefits
------------------------------ 
•	Up to £30k - £40k (depending on experience)
•	Company share options
•	Generous pension and health insurance
•	Office located right next to Victoria station
•	Company lunch every Friday!
•	Regular team events
•	Casual dress code

Landbay is an equal opportunities employer who cares about fostering a welcoming, inclusive culture for all employees. Additionally, we have signed the HM Treasury’s Women in Finance Charter in an effort to promote a balanced and fair workplace within the financial services industry.

jobs.title: Mid/Senior/Principal Java Software Engineer
jobs.description:
About You
------------------------------ 
* You can code! (Java 8, Spring Boot, JPA) 
* You know what a good architecture looks like (ReST, distributed systems, eventual consistency, AMQP, high availability, ...). And more importantly, you know what a bad architecture looks like! 
* You know what CI & CD mean and have used Docker. 
* You're comfortable with databases, including designing them! (e.g. MySQL) 
* You live and breathe Agile. i.e you know what we mean by stories, scrums, retros, branching, JIRA, 
* You can find your away around most Linux OSs 
* Bonus points if you've used: AWS (EC2, RDS, ELB), Terraform, Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana, Redis, Memcache, RabbitMQ, NoSQL

Education & Experience 
------------------------------ 
* 3+ years experience
* Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience 


Role 
------------------------------ 
* Start from a user story and design a solution spanning micro-services (including interface definition, messaging, etc.) 
* Develop, test and deploy software (development/unit/service testing) and ensure high code quality throughout 
* Collaborate with the team to continuously improve the architecture 
* Contribute to continuous improvement within the scrum team 
* Participate in the "automate everything" mentality (e.g. Continuous Deployment pipelines, Jenkins, etc.) 
* Prototype and spike new concepts, features, use of technology

Candidate Profile 
------------------------------ 
* Want to be part of the company, not just crunching code all the time and you know why that makes you a better software engineer
* Not afraid to try things or to fail 
* Loves white-boarding problems and solutions
* Lives and breathes agile development and lean processes; knows when to prototype
* Confidence in their conviction but recognises the value in diverse opinions in the creative process
* Want to do things the right way but accept that sometimes the wrong way is better 
* Good sense of humour 
* Understands that good communication skills are often more important to developing good software than the tin it sits on
* Some experience in a start-up environment would be ideal
